name: Parmesan Roasted Green Beans
description: Recipe video above. The most amazing SUPER SPEEDY way to prepare fresh green beans!! Tender crisp garlic green beans with terrific crunch from breadcrumbs and savoury from parmesan. Be prepared to fight over the little parmesan wafers - the are the gold nuggets!!
recipeIngredient: 500 g / 1 lb green beans (, ends trimmed)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220C/425F OR the broiler/grill on high with the shelf about 30cm/12" from the heat source.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 220C/425F OR the broiler/grill on high with the shelf about 30cm/12" from the heat source.

recipeInstructions.text: Pile beans on a tray. Drizzle with 1 tbsp of the oil, garlic, salt and pepper. Toss.
recipeInstructions.name: Pile beans on a tray. Drizzle with 1 tbsp of the oil, garlic, salt and pepper. Toss.

recipeInstructions.text: Line up on the tray, pushing the beans next to each other (I do 2 rows).
recipeInstructions.name: Line up on the tray, pushing the beans next to each other (I do 2 rows).

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle with breadcrumbs then parmesan. Drizzle with remaining oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle with breadcrumbs then parmesan. Drizzle with remaining oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Roast for 15 minutes or broil/grill for 8 minutes until the parmesan is golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast for 15 minutes or broil/grill for 8 minutes until the parmesan is golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a spatula/egg flip to transfer beans to serving platter. Serve immediately!
recipeInstructions.name: Use a spatula/egg flip to transfer beans to serving platter. Serve immediately!

review.reviewBody: I keep finding your recipes to try and all have been great
When the green beans are in season this is the quickest and best way to load up on vegetables!
Who knew beans could taste so good?! I also love using this exact recipe for baby broccolini when I'm feeling like funking good ol' steamed veg up! Highly recommended!
These were delicious! I used gluten free panko bread crumbs and vegan Parmesan(allergies) and they were perfect!
Seriously the best green beans recipe ever, Nagi!!! It was easy and so delicious that my carnivore teen was snitching beans off everyone elseâ€™s plates!!

Thank you so much for sharing this recipe, Nagi!! I made these green beans for our Christmas Eve dinner, to go with steak, and they came out so yummy! I love roasted broccoli and cauliflower, but never thought of roasting green beans! This will be my go-to recipe! Merry Christmas to you and your family, thank you for your wonderful website.

I had the most satisfying no-waste dinner tonight! I used the leftover panko-parm mix from your chicken parmigiana recipe for these beans, and the leftover chicken parm sauce for my gnocchi :) An amazingly delicious dinner yet again, courtesy of you Nagi. Thank-you!
Thank you so much Nagi, so easy and so tasty. I served these as a side to your Epic Chunky Beef and Mushroom Pie. Keep up the great work!
Yum! Yum! And triple yum! Parmesan cheese makes everything heavenly ðŸ‘¼ Thanks for another winner, Nagi and Dozer x
Haricot vert ready here in France. 1st harvest today and  tried this recipe.  Delicious. Definitely do it again ...and again.
Delicious! It came out perfectly. Would this also work in an air fryer? x
